TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ISerializationSurrogate

Docs.summary: Implements a serialization surrogate selector that allows one object to perform serialization and deserialization of another.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetObjectData (object obj, System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetObjectData(object obj, class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed
Public Sub GetObjectData (obj As Object, info As SerializationInfo, context As StreamingContext)
public: void GetObjectData(System::Object ^ obj, System::Runtime::Serialization::SerializationInfo ^ info, System::Runtime::Serialization::StreamingContext context);

Docs.summary: Populates the provided with the data needed to serialize the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Extracts data from object `obj` and stores it in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>`info` parameter.
Having located the surrogate, this method stores information on the object `obj` in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>`info` parameter. This information describes its view of that object, including the object's fields, properties, and current values. The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> might correspond to the actual object, or it can be a synthesized view of the surrogate.
This method is protected by a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand?displayProperty=nameWithType> for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.SerializationFormatter?displayProperty=nameWithType> specified.

Docs.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

MemberSignature.Value: public object SetObjectData (object obj, System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector selector);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object SetObjectData(object obj, class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector selector) cil managed
Public Function SetObjectData (obj As Object, info As SerializationInfo, context As StreamingContext, selector As ISurrogateSelector) As Object

public: System::Object ^ SetObjectData(System::Object ^ obj, System::Runtime::Serialization::SerializationInfo ^ info, System::Runtime::Serialization::StreamingContext context, System::Runtime::Serialization::ISurrogateSelector ^ selector);

Docs.param: The information to populate the object.
The source from which the object is deserialized.
The surrogate selector where the search for a compatible surrogate begins.
Docs.summary: Populates the object using the information in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializationSurrogate.SetObjectData%2A> method is called during deserialization. With this method, you can take the empty <xref:System.Object>`obj` that has already been created, and enter <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>`info` data into that object. Constructors are not invoked during deserialization of information and reconstruction of the object.
This method is protected by a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand?displayProperty=nameWithType> for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.SerializationFormatter?displayProperty=nameWithType> specified.

Docs.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
